results.title: Peach and pear harvester
results.brief_description: Picture only. Footage of specialised machine used for quickly removing fruit from peach and pair trees. The machine envelopes a tree and then vibrates which causes the fruit to fall off into a catching device. This is an odd process to view as the tree is shaken quite violently by the machine and the fruit falls into the catching device in a dramamtic fashion.

results.title: Pleuro
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description:
Film made to alert farmers of Pleuro-Pneoumonia, a nothern-state illness that could cripple local cattle if it was introduced into Victoria. Details how the illness manifests itself in cattle, its symptoms and how it is treated. Also describes the process of quarantine if Pleuro is suspected.

Uses diagramatical animations and illustrations throughout. These feature an animated map of Australia and Victoria. Numerous shots of cattle in hot and dry conditions. Amongst other bloody imagery there is footage of organs being removed from diseased cow and placed in a tin. Nice cheesey sequence of quarantine signs being placed around a property. Good ‘The End’ title.

group_siblings.title: Where the River Kiewa Flows
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture

results.title: Archival prints
results.brief_description:
1. Where the River Kiewa Flows - Focuses on the Kiewa Butter Factory and how it is using excess skim and butter milk to provide food for its piggery. By doing this it is increasing its profits and reducing waste. The Victorian Department of Agriculture’s ‘Pig Expert’ devised a plan for maximum efficiency of the piggery, taking into account that there would be more excess milk in the summer than the winter.

Contains footage of the Kiewa piggery as well as the butter production plant and surrounding district, which all look good.

  1. The Challenge - Film carries an inspirational message and is largely concerned with the need for all Victorians to consolidate their current strong agricultural position by embracing ‘progress’ and moving forward with new ideas. Very earnest throughout.

Opens with dissolves between Melbourne cityscapes and then focuses on numerous, well-shot general agricultural and farm scenes from the late 1950s. This includes shots of wheat farming, grain export, livestock and the people behind it.

Last shots are of Melbourne. The final one being a pan, shot from above, down St Kilda Rd away from the city, towards the Shrine of Rememberance.

Excellent titles/the end.

results.title: On the land (i)
results.brief_description:
Fast-paced montage of general farm and animal imagery. Seems to be the title sequence for a television series. Ends with a superimposed title. End of reel features an alternative superimposition that reads ‘On the Land S-TV8’.
Soundtrack is comprised solely of up-beat orchestral music.

results.title: The Australian Alps: Mirka's Palace of Dreams
results.creator_credit: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This program is the last in a series of 6 documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia.
Mirka Mora is an eccentric artist, French by birth, who had never before ventured into the wilderness nor slept in a tent. Along with Tim McCartney Snape, the first Australian ever to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, and a Nepalese Sherpa, she travels into the Kosciusko wilderness. Mirka’s unique and expressive personality helps viewers see and experience this wilderness from an artist’s perspective. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.
results.title_for_label: The Australian Alps: Mirka’s Palace of Dreams
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: 16mm Prints
results.brief_description:
1. Granville Cattle Shoot - Unedited footage of bulldozers and men clearing land in order to create pens to house cattle. Cattle is then shot in the head and picked-up by a bulldozer/tractor that dumps the dead, or close to dead body in a pit with other bloodied carcases. The pit of dead cows is then filled with soil.

  2. Mice Milking - Documents the process in which scientists at Dandenong milk mice with special machinery. The milk is then given to the American Cancer Council who use it to research cancer treatment. A mouse attached to the milking machine looks quite bizarre. One mouse yeilds a third of a teaspoon of milk per milking session. Good footage of the machine in action.

  3. The problem of Lamb Survival - Shows how the Department of Agriculture is trying to improve the amount of lambs that are born each year and survive to adulthood. Includes footage of a mobile laboratory in the field.

  4. N.A.S.A moon shots - Filmed photographs of general space imagery, focusing on the moon and spacecraft. Contains photograph or earth from space.

  5. Eclipse 23/10/76’ - Rushes of countryside, sheep and cars in the day and at night.

results.title: Green Fingers: Pest and Disease Control
results.brief_description:
Please be advised: this is an archival film and contemporary advice should be sought when handling chemicals and poisons.

‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Pest and Disease Control’, Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to use agricultural sprays on a rose garden at Burnley Gardens.

Diseases described include black spot, aphids and powdery mildew. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: The Australian Alps: Mirka's Palace of Dreams (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This program is the last in a series of six documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. Mirka Mora is an eccentric artist, French by birth, who had never before ventured into the wilderness nor slept in a tent. Along with Tim McCartney Snape, the first Australian ever to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, and a Nepalese Sherpa, she travels into the Kosciusko wilderness. Mirka’s unique and expressive personality helps viewers see and experience this wilderness from an artist’s perspective.
results.title_for_label: The Australian Alps: Mirka’s Palace of Dreams (Captioned)

results.title: Daintree: The Vanishing Rainforest (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Danae Gunn, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
A child returns from the future, a time when forests no longer exist and we see the rainforest and its most unusual inhabitants through her eyes. She grows to love the forest and cannot understand some of the things she sees happening. An imaginative and fascinating story which emphasises the delicate balance of nature, and how easily it can be destroyed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Danae Gunn, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
